title: Unable to Access  Local Filesystem
body:
Getting an error while trying to connect to local files.
"Cannot connect to the remixd daemon. Please make sure you have the remixd running in the background."
Remixd is already installed and running in background.
Tried with installing both locally and globally. Was working fine before 0.6.8 update
same problem here...
same problem
@ketan-sol Are you trying to share a hardhat project?
@ketan-sol  Can you check if it is fixed with remixd v0.6.10 ?
same problem here
@Aniket-Engg  Still facing the same issue.

@ketan-sol Can you add more details like OS and browser you are using?

Are you using any framework project?
@Aniket-Engg for me , I am using chrome on an m1 mac. Its a foundry / hardhat project. I still have the error in v.0.6.10
Is it with hardhat project too with remixd v0.6.10? For foundry, there is a fix in progress.
@Aniket-Engg yes. But i am just running `remixd` and not specifying a src file. shouldnt it still read it ?
If you just run `remixd` , it shares your current working directory with remix IDE
@Aniket-Engg  brave on m1 mac. Simple hardhat project
okay, thanks for the info @ketan-sol . We are working on another fix. will let you know once it is released
@ketan-sol Can you try it with v0.6.11 and check if it is fixed?

@Aniket-Engg  still facing same issue. Remixd was successfully installed and running but got a deprecation warning -

"(node:2054) [DEP0128] DeprecationWarning: Invalid 'main' field in '/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@remix-project/remixd/node_modules/@remixproject/plugin-utils/package.json' of 'src/index.js'. Please either fix that or report it to the module author"
@ketan-sol This seems a warning only. Are you able to connect Remixd successfully with Remix IDE?
cc: @bunsenstraat
@ketan-sol we should connect on a call if you can. Sort this out.

same here
remixd -v 0.6.11
Mac Air M2 OS: ventura 13.1
tried installing remix locally and globally. and run `remixd -s <absolute path> --remix-ide https://remix.ethereum.org` It returns the alert
`Cannot connect to the remixd daemon. Please make sure you have the remixd running in the background.`
@bunsenstraat sure let me know

> @bunsenstraat sure let me know

Let's schedule a call. I am in Europe time zone.

any update?
got same issue with latest version 0.6.12
Same issue with mac m1 and brave
was having the same issue, tried putting shields down and worked
@RohanShrothrium can you confirm the shields fix works?
**Working sol:** If you are on brave, go to the search tab above and click on lion symbol and turn off shields!
version 0.6.13 still having same issue. Tried with shields off. Still facing same issue.
@ketan-sol You're specifying http in the -u, while remix runs on https
> **Working sol:** If you are on brave, go to the search tab above and click on lion symbol and turn off shields! > > exactly that should work fine. can everyone confirm?
